alert.note: Alert for Baker; Calhoun; Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 1:44PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Georgia, including the following counties, Baker, Calhoun and Early. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 144 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blakely, Arlington, Leary, Douglasville, Rowena, Commissary Hill, Turman, Parksville, Colomokee, Early Co A/p, Crestview, Iveys Mill, Ferrell Crossroads, Bethany, Kolomoki Mounds Sp, Patmos and Milford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
